body:
As it was getting darker into the night, protests in Cairo, and few other Egyptian governorates, didn’t seem to unrest. Two citizens were confirmed dead in Suez, with an alleged –not confirmed- call for a curfew in the city. In Alexandria, few thousands of people started an open sit in. Allegedly police thugs in El Mahala started destroying public property, while people were occupying the main El Shona square.
But of course, the most dominant news was from Cairo’s important Tahrir Square. A rally of thousands announced today they will start an open sit in, till all their demands fulfilled. The sit in was kept peaceful as possible till the police announced intolerance towards protesters in square. And they acted to disperse them with all possible ways.

 @Alaa confirmed that doctors were badly needed.
http://twitter.com/alaa/status/30015339991408640

try to move ppl to hospitals instead, doctors need medecine & equipment ♻ @husseinelsaid: @alaa doctors needed at Tahrir DESPERATELY pls RT

Earlier today The Egyptian government blocked Twitter, Bumbester, as well as cut the mobile coverage in Tahrir, leaving protesters with no means to communicate with the outer world! This led to a spontaneous act by people in the neighborhood to unblock their wireless passwords so protestors can go online:
@Mohrad
http://twitter.com/Mohrad/status/30015783459356673
المواطنين والمحلات لغوا باسوردات شبكات الوايرلس والمعتصمين في التحرير يستطيعون الآن التواصل مع الناس#Jan25 #fb
Citizens and shops cancelled their wireless routers’ passwords. Protesters in Tahrir square can reach people now.

Apart from that, also, in a very human act, nearby shops started supplying people with food and water:
@Mohrad
http://twitter.com/Mohrad/status/30021067795865600
من التحرير: هارديز طلع ساندوتشات صغيرة للمعتصمين والأمن منعهم وطلب منهم يقفلوا ويمشوا ورفضوا يقفلوا ومشاركين الشباب
From Tahrir: Hardees gave out free sandwiches to protesters, but the police stopped them and asked to leave. Shops refused, and joined the people.


Few celebrities  joined the protests, and were updating their Twitter accounts as: actors Amr Waked and Khaled Aboul Naga, female announcer Bouthayna Kamel, director Amr Salama and politician Ayman Nour. 
http://twitter.com/amrwaked
http://twitter.com/basboussa1
http://twitter.com/kalnaga
http://twitter.com/ayman_nour
http://www.twitter.com/amrmsalama
They sent a statement by protests:
http://www.facebook.com/filmmakeramrsalama?v=wall
رسالة من المعتصمين: كلنا موجودين في ميدان التحرير مش هنتحرك، و هنبات و هنكمل مظاهرتنا بكره الصبح رغم كل اللي بيعمله الأمن، اللي يقدر منا ينزل للناس دي ينزل، و اللي يقدر يجيبلهم مية أو أكل يجيب، و اللي مايقدرش ينشر الخبر دا و مايصدقش اللي بيتقال عن إنهم هيمشوا أو هيتحركوا من مكانهم... قوم يا مصري

From protestors: We will stay in Tahrir Sq. We will not more. We will stay and continue our demonstration tomorrow morning despite brutality from the police. Who can come join us, then do. Who can bring us water or food, please do. We will get them out of the country. Believe that. Get involved Egyptians!

It was around 10:00 PM Cairo local time when Farouk tweeted from Tahrir Sq.
farokadel 
  http://twitter.com/farokadel/status/30025710827470848

من التحرير المعنويات مرتفعة بس الامن بيجهز هجوم تقريبا
There are high hopes. But the police looks like as if preparing for something.

Sandmonkey also noted a fun fact of the day.
Sandmonkey 
Fun fact of the day: not a single girl got sexually harassed today. Everyone acted with utter respect. #jan25
http://twitter.com/Sandmonkey/status/30033160666357760

Hoever, that of course have not continued long before  police started to disperse protesters in Tahrir square by force at around midnight by thrown by tear gas, chased and also brutally mass arrests!
